contentrichtext.text: {{Use British English|date=November 2012}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> Name = Roots to Branches | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Jethro Tull (band)|Jethro Tull]] | Cover = JethroTullRootstoBranches.jpg | Released = 4 September 1995 <small>([[United Kingdom|UK]])</small><br/>12 September 1995 <small>([[United States|U.S.]])</small> | Recorded = December 1994 until June 1995 | Genre = [[Hard rock]] <br> [[Progressive rock]] <br> [[World music]] | Length = 60:00 | Label = [[Chrysalis Records|Chrysalis]] | Producer = Ian Anderson | Last album = ''[[Nightcap (album)|Nightcap]]''<br />(1993) | This album = '''''Roots to Branches'''''<br />(1995) | Next album = ''[[In Concert (Jethro Tull)|In Concert]]''<br />(1995) | | Misc = {{Singles | Name = <br/> Roots to Branches <br/> | Type = studio | Single 1 = [[Rare and Precious Chain]] | Single 1 date = 1995 | Single 2 = [[Beside Myself]] | Single 2 date = 1995 }} }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{rating|2.5|5}}<ref>{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r220813|tab=review|last=Eder|first=Bruce|label=''Roots to Branches''}}</ref> }} '''''Roots to Branches''''' is the 19th studio album by the British band [[Jethro Tull (band)|Jethro Tull]]. It carries characteristics of Tull's classic 1970s art-rock and folk-rock roots alongside jazz and Arabic and Far Eastern influences. All songs were written by [[Ian Anderson (singer and musician)|Ian Anderson]] and recorded at his home studio. This is the last Tull album to feature [[Dave Pegg]] on the bass, and the first to feature keyboardist [[Andrew Giddings]] as an official band member, although he had contributed to ''[[Catfish Rising]]'' (1991) on a sessional basis. ==Track listing== {{tracklist | title1 = Roots to Branches | length1 = 5:11 | title2 = Rare and Precious Chain | length2 = 3:35 | title3 = Out of the Noise | length3 = 3:25 | title4 = This Free Will | length4 = 4:05 | title5 = Valley | length5 = 6:07 | title6 = Dangerous Veils | length6 = 5:35 | title7 = Beside Myself | length7 = 5:50 | title8 = Wounded, Old and Treacherous | length8 = 7:50 | title9 = At Last, Forever | length9 = 7:55 | title10 = Stuck in the August Rain | length10 = 4:06 | title11 = Another Harry's Bar | length11 = 6:21 }} ==Remaster== In January 2007, a remastered edition of the album was released. It contained no bonus tracks. ==Credits== * [[Ian Anderson (singer and musician)|Ian Anderson]] – vocals, concert flute, bamboo flute, acoustic guitar * [[Martin Barre]] – electric guitars * [[Andrew Giddings]] – keyboards * [[Dave Pegg]] – bass guitar (tracks 3, 5 & 11) * [[Steve Bailey]] – bass guitar (tracks 1, 6, 7, 8, 9 & 10) * [[Doane Perry]] – drums ==Charts== '''Album''' - [[Billboard magazine|Billboard]] (North America) {| class="wikitable" width="20%" !Year !Chart !Position |- | 1995 | The Billboard 200 | 114 |- |} ==Release details== *1995, UK, Chrysalis 8-35418-4, Release Date 31 August 1995, Cassette *1995, UK, Chrysalis CDCHR 6109, Release Date 4 September 1995, CD *1995, UK, Chrysalis CHR 6109, Release Date 4 September 1995, LP *1995, UK, Chrysalis TCCHR 6109, Release Date ? ? 1995, Cassette *1995, UK, Chrysalis 8-35418-2, Release Date ? ? 1995, CD *1995, U.S., Chrysalis F2 35418, Release Date 12 September 1995, CD *1995, U.S., Chrysalis CHR 6109, Release Date 12 September 1995, LP *1995, Australia, Chrysalis CDCHR 6109, Release Date 27 October 1995, CD ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Jethro Tull}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Roots To Branches}} [[Category:Jethro Tull albums]] [[Category:1995 albums]] [[Category:Chrysalis Records albums]] [[Category:Albums produced by Ian Anderson]]
